metadata.title: Legalthon 2025 | Results
metadata.description: Results of the Academic Hackathon on Legal Aspects of Blockchain. Faculty of Law (UBA), Cardano Community, FinGurú, Project Catalyst.

hero.subtitle: Academic Hackathon on Legal Matters of Blockchain.
hero.partners: Law School (UBA) • Cardano Community • FinGurú • Project Catalyst

phraseCarousel.notYourKeys: Not your keys, not your coins

innovationPath.title: The Path of Innovation
innovationPath.card1Body: Cardano and the blockchain ecosystem depend on robust research to mature. To fill this gap, the Cardano Community, the UBA Law School, and FinGurú joined forces, creating an academic space open to innovation to raise the standard of legal debate regarding these technologies.
innovationPath.card2Body: A massive and vibrant event: 93 registered participants, 8 teams presenting proposals, and a 12-hour day with expert panels and international speakers. Before an excellence jury, 3 winning teams were selected based for the quality of their proposals.
innovationPath.card3Body: It didn't end with the proposals. Thanks to funding from Project Catalyst, the teams worked for months with specialized mentors, transforming their initial pitches into academic papers with methodological rigor and theoretical depth.
innovationPath.card4Body: Each team had the personalized accompaniment of a tutor, who provided support, methodological guidance, and peer review to strengthen both the quality of the final papers and the rigor of the research.
innovationPath.card5Body: After the publication of the academic papers, a ceremony was held to recognize and award the three finalist teams of the Legalthon, closing a cycle of research, mentoring, and collaboration between academia and the blockchain ecosystem.
innovationPath.card6Body: The result is free and tangible knowledge. These documents, licensed under Apache 2.0, are a concrete contribution from Argentina to enrich the global legal understanding of blockchain technology.
